plugins.name: Quick Roblox UI Exporter by Solys
plugins.description:
How it Works:

  1. Name the files inside Figma you want to export as one of the keywords: 'Frame' , 'Button', 'Icon', etc
  2. Preferably use a 1920x1080 background behind your UI, for example have the settings frame UI on a 1920x1080 background, group it together and name it 'Settings'
  3. The plugin will export and auto organize, you'll receive a file with Settings screen inside, an import reference for the Settings screen and all assets needed inside. Saving you hours on big projects as you can select 20, 30 screens at once and click export!


Why You‚Äôll Love It:


‚ö° One-Click Export ‚Äì Select the UI screens you want to export and click the button


üìÅ Neatly Organized ‚Äì Auto-sorts files by screens for easy access, all stored nicely in a zipped folder


‚è≥ Saves Time ‚Äì Focus on design, not file management & exporting


‚úÖ Hassle-Free ‚Äì Works seamlessly with any project, automatically detects UI it needs to export by it's name, if it contains following keywords in it's name the plugin will automatically export the UI as a PNG file:

Frame

Button

UI

Scroll

Line

Title

Subtitle

Captions don't matter just include the keyword into one of those UIs you made and it'll export it automatically, you also have it nicely named for easy work with importing.

plugins.name: Paint Mixer - Try for FREE
plugins.description:
Paint Mixer allows you to blend two colors just like in real life, using Kubelka & Munk algorithm to predict how light interacts with mixed pigments under natural light for the most authentic results. Learn More from this video.


Features

  1. Accurately mix two colors using the Kubelka & Munk theory.
  2. Apply the mixed color as a fill or stroke to Figma layers.
  3. Create a 9-step gradient layer and linear-fill layer from the start and end colors.


How to Use

  1. Select the end color from the palette box below.
  2. Rotate the handle clockwise to gradually mix the start color with the end color. Rotate counterclockwise to unmix.
  3. Click the hex code to copy color.
  4. Hover on the dropdown to show more actions (see image 2).
  5. Double-click one of the palettes to change its color.


Tips

  1. Rotate two full revolutions (720¬∞) to completely turn into the end color.
  2. Click 3 dots at the bottom to show more options.
  3. Grabbing the handle further from the center of the wheel gives you more precise control.


Pricing

  1. 10 free actions with full access to all features. Actions include using the mixed color and opening the plugin.
  2. Unlock unlimited access for a one-time purchase.


Credits

  1. This plugin uses spectral.js to handle color mixing which is licensed under the MIT License.
  2. Inspiration from Paper app for iPad.

accepted.name: Saranomy
accepted.description: I make premium Figma Plugins

plugins.tagline: Realistic color blending using Kubelka-Munk theory

plugins.name: Variable Sherlock üïµÔ∏è‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è
plugins.description:
Variable Sherlock üïµÔ∏è‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è


Inspect every variable by selecting any layer in your design. Variable Sherlock will get every used variable in the selection, organized by node and specify its:

  1. Variable name
  2. Property applied to
  3. Type of variable
  4. Value of variable
  5. Collection of variable
  6. Library the collection comes from


You can also filter and sort your results to get specific kinds of variables based on name, type, property, etc.


Notes

  1. It can take some time to inspect large selections. If this happens, try to select a smaller amount of layers.
  2. The shown value reflects the value of the variable in the active mode for the layer it is connected to.
  3. Library names can only be shown if the library is imported to the file the plugin is running in. Otherwise, the library name will be left blank.


I'm always trying to improve the plugin. If this was useful for you have any suggestions or find any bug, don't hesitate to send me a message or buy me a coffee!

accepted.name: Rodrigo D√≠az Salvadores

plugins.name: Variable Agent
plugins.description:
Variable Agent

The plugin is designed to facilitate the management of variable collections within Figma. At the moment, it allows users to copy and paste variable collections, making it easier to manage design tokens and other variable data across different projects and files.


Current Capabilities

- View Variable Collections: Users can view all local variable collections available in Figma.

- Copy Collections: Users can select a variable collection and copy it to their clipboard.

- Paste Collections: Users can paste the copied variable collection into another document or project.


Steps to Use the Plugin in Figma

1. Open the Plugin: Launch the plugin from the Figma plugins menu.

2. View Collections: Upon opening, the plugin will automatically fetch and display all available variable collections.

4. Select a Collection: Use the dropdown menu to select the collection you wish to copy.

5. Copy the Collection: Click the "Copy Collection" button to copy the selected variable collection to your clipboard.

6. Paste the Collection: Navigate to the document where you want to paste the collection, launch the plugin, and click the "Paste Collection" button.

7. Check Status Messages: Monitor the status messages displayed in the plugin for feedback on your actions.


Limitations

- Draft file Support: If you copy a collection with multiple modes, and paste in a file in your draft, it won't work. This is because draft file only support 1 mode.


- Aliased variable collections: The plugin does not currently support pasting variable collections with aliased variables. Aliased variables are those that reference other collection. It will recognize the alias but will not be able to resolve the reference.

accepted.name: Raymond
accepted.description: Strategic Product Designer and Creator of Frames and Divs.

plugins.tagline: Copy and paste variable collection across files and projects

plugins.name: Figma to Shopify with Foxify - Shopify Smart Visual Page Builder
plugins.description:
Figma to Shopify with Foxify Visual Page Builder


Ship responsive and optimized pixel-perfect Shopify pages and sections in seconds with the Figma to Shopify with Foxify plugin by FoxEcom.


Copy any Figma design, paste it into the Foxify page builder, and publish it live with 1-click.


No code needed.

plugins.name: Coordinate
plugins.description:
A simple plugin for quickly targeting nodes and extracting key positional data (X, Y, width, height) for use in other applications.


_Built using [The DataFace's Figma plugin template](https://github.com/the-dataface/figma-plugin-svelte-vite)_


How-to


1. Prefix desired nodes with a uniform string (e.g. `COORDINATE.` or `#` or `@`).

2. Once the plugin is initialized, enter that string in the search box (the default is `COORDINATE`) and run the command.

3. The positional data will show up below in the plugin's UI as JSON. You can download the results directly using the download button in the top-right corner of the results box.

accepted.description: A digital agency, specializing in data visualization

plugins.name: Text Style Creator
plugins.description:
What This Plugin Does

  1. Creates local text styles from any selected text layer
  2. Preserves all typography variable connections (font family, size, weight, etc.)
  3. Automatically finds and applies styles to all matching text layers in the current page


How to Use

  1. Select any text layer that you want to create a style from
  2. Run the plugin


The text style will be named using the content of the selected text layer

The plugin will automatically apply the new style to all text layers with matching properties


Key Features

Supports all typography variables

Batch processing: select multiple text layers to create multiple styles at once

Intelligent matching: finds all text layers with identical properties


Preserves variable connections for:

  1. Font family
  2. Font size
  3. Font style
  4. Font weight
  5. Line height
  6. Letter spacing
  7. Paragraph spacing
  8. Paragraph indent


Note: Make sure your text layers have the desired properties before creating styles, as these will be preserved in the created style.

plugins.name: African Name Generator
plugins.description:
African Name Generator Plugin


What It Does

The African Name Generator plugin helps you quickly add authentic African names to your designs. You can generate and insert first names, last names, or full names from Nigeria, Kenya, Ghana, South Africa, and Ethiopia.


How to Use It

1. Open the Plugin: Find and launch the African Name Generator plugin in your Figma plugins menu.

2. Select Parameters:

- Country: Choose Nigeria, Kenya, Ghana, South Africa, Ethiopia, Egypt, Senegal, Uganda, Tanzania, Morocco, and Cameroon.

- Gender: Pick male or female.

- Name Type: Select first name, last name, or full name.

3. Generate Name: Click the "Generate Name" button. The name will appear in the plugin.

4. Insert Name:

- Select a text layer in your Figma file.

- Click the "Insert Name" button. The plugin will insert the name into the selected text layer.


Limitations

- Name List: The names come from a fixed list. Not every African name is included.

- Font Support: The plugin uses fonts available in Figma. Ensure the desired font is available.

- Single Text Layer: Insert names into one text layer at a time. Repeat the process for multiple layers.


The African Name Generator plugin allows you to easily add real African names to your designs.

accepted.name: Joseph Kalu
accepted.description: I am a fintech and crypto product designer

plugins.tagline: Generate Unique African Names for your designs

plugins.name: Tabletop
plugins.description:
Play board games and card games, right in Figma! This plugin helps with card management, dice rolling, hidden information, and general usability.


Open the playground Figma file for pre-made cards, tokens, and dice!


Features

  1. Sneak a peek at any card or token by selecting it while it is face-down. You will get a preview of the front of the card in your plugin window.
  2. See how many objects you currently have selected.
  3. Flip any number of cards or tokens that you have selected.
  4. Roll any number of dice that you have selected.
  5. Stack objects - this aligns them horizontally and offsets them by 1px vertically, randomizes the layer order, and flips them face-down.
  6. Shuffle objects - this randomizes the layer order of every object you have selected.
  7. Expand a stack of objects - this lays them out side-by-side and flips them face-up, allowing you to quickly see all objects in a stack.
  8. When you select any object, automatically bring it to the top of the layer hierarchy so it appears on top of other objects.


Custom Card & Token Preparation

  1. Create a card or token component that contains a layer named "Front" and a layer named "Back".
  2. Duplicate the component into as many instances as you need for that particular card/token.
  3. Now you can use the Tabletop plugin to manipulate the instances of your cards or tokens!
  4. Optional: Export a PNG image of your "Front" layer, paste it into your component beneath the other layers, and rename it "Preview". This will speed up the preview image that is generated in the plugin when the object is selected.


Custom Dice Preparation

  1. Create a die component that contains at least 2 layers named "Face".
  2. Duplicate the component into as many instances as you need.
  3. Now you can use the Tabletop plugin to roll your dice!


Feedback Needed!

I'm actively working on this plugin, so please leave comments with feedback and I'll try to refine and add features accordingly.

accepted.name: Colin Brandt
accepted.description:
Full-time product designer at Microsoft
Free-time game designer

plugins.tagline: Play board games and card games, right in Figma! This plugin helps with card management and more.

102039.name: Layer Renaming
102039.description:
Layer Renaming: Streamline Your Workflow with Effortless Layer Management


Revolutionize your Figma workflow with Layer Renaming, the ultimate solution for efficient layer organization. This powerful plugin offers:


1. Selective Layer Renaming: Choose specific layers and modify their names with ease.

2. Time-Based Ordering: Automatically arrange layers based on their creation time for a logical naming sequence.

3. Customizable Naming Patterns: Input a primary layer name and add custom symbols or numbering as desired.

4. One-Click Renaming: Instantly rename multiple layers with a single confirmation, saving you valuable time.


Whether you're working on complex designs or maintaining consistency across projects, Layer Renaming simplifies your process, allowing you to focus on what truly matters - your creative vision.


Boost your productivity today with Layer Renaming - the fast, intuitive, and indispensable tool for every Figma user!

plugins.name: SF Symbol Generator
plugins.description:
A Figma plugin to generate static or variable SF Symbol SVGs from your Figma icons that can be imported into the SF Symbols App or directly to Xcode as an asset.

Compatible with SF Symbols 5 and up.


Features

- Convert a single Figma icon to an SF Symbol SVG

- Create variable SF Symbols from three icons (Ultra Light, Regular, and Black)

- Simple interface for selecting icons and assigning weights

- Dynamic attribution in SVG exports with plugin name and version

- Compatible with SF Symbols 5 and later versions

- Smart naming based on parent component or frame names

- The icons width will also be respected in the SF Symbol SVG accordingly

- Interactive SVG Preview with path direction visualization


Usage

1. Select one or more icon layers in your Figma document

2. Open the SF Symbol Generator plugin

3. Click "Scan Selected Icons" to detect your selected icons

4. Choose between Static or Variable mode:

- Static: Select one icon from your selection to create an SF Symbol

- Variable: Assign your icons to Ultra Light, Regular, and Black weights

5. Click "Create SF Symbol" to generate your SF Symbol SVG

accepted.name: Dustin K
accepted.description: A product designer based in Berlin, creating a powerful creative editor at IMG.LY.

plugins.tagline: Generate custom "static" or "variable" SF Symbols directly from Figma.

plugins.name: Layer Manager
plugins.description:
Layer Manager is designed to improve your workflow by providing quick access to important layer management functions. 


This plugin focuses on three primary operations: listing layers, controlling layer visibility, and renaming layers. 


Getting Started

  1. Open your Figma design file.
  2. Select the layers or frames you want to manage.
  3. Search for the Layer Manager plugin from the Figma plugin menu.
  4. Launch the plugin. 


Basic Operations

Viewing Layers:

After launching the plugin with your desired layers or frames selected, you'll see a list of all the layers within your selection.


Toggling Layer Visibility

Individual Layers:

  1. Find the layer you want to toggle in the list.
  2. Click the visibility icon next to the layer name to show or hide it.
  3. The change will be immediately reflected in your Figma design.

All Layers:

  1. Use the "Hide all" button to hide all layers in the list at once.
  2. Use the "Show all" button to make all layers in the list visible.


Renaming Layers:

  1. Locate the layer you want to rename in the list.
  2. Click on the layer name to enter edit mode.
  3. Type the new name for the layer.
  4. Press Enter or click outside the input field to confirm the new name.


Refreshing the Layer List:

If you make changes to your selection in the Figma file while the plugin is open:

  1. Click the "Refresh layers" button in the plugin interface.
  2. The layer list will update to reflect your current selection in the Figma document.


Searching Layers:

  1. Click on the search bar at the top of the layer list in the plugin interface and type in your search term. This could be: a layer name or a layer type (e.g., "rectangle," "text," or "group").
  2. As you type, the layer list would dynamically update to show only the layers that match your search criteria.
  3. To clear the search and see all layers again, simply delete your search term.


Tips for Efficient Use

  1. Start with a focused selection in your Figma file to manage specific groups of layers more effectively.
  2. Use the bulk hide/show actions to quickly toggle visibility for comparing different versions of your design.
  3. Regularly refresh the layer list if you're making changes in your Figma file while the plugin is open.
  4. Rename layers directly from the plugin to maintain consistent naming conventions without switching contexts.

accepted.name: Soliudeen Ogunsola
accepted.description: Product Designer.

plugins.tagline: A better way to view, hide, and rename your design layers.

96440.tagline: Export design tokens from Figma to Github

plugins.name: Asterisk
plugins.description:
Annotate your designs with Asterisk!


Creating annotations

  1. Annotate to the left, right, above or below a target
  2. Add an optional header
  3. Add optional notes (Shift+Enter to add multiple lines)
  4. Add smaller secondary notes and an optional URL
  5. Customize the spacing between an annotation and its target
  6. Choose the color of an annotation


Global controls

  1. Show/hide all annotations on a page
  2. Lock/unlock all annotations on a page
  3. Delete all annotations on a page
  4. Refresh annotation locations (useful if a component instance inherits changes and moves)


Quality of life features

  1. Annotations follow their targets*
  2. Move an existing annotation to a new target
  3. Change any property of a selected annotation even after it was created
  4. Press Enter after typing in an input to quickly create an annotation
  5. Collapse the UI so you can keep it open but out of the way
  6. Double click any color in the UI to change Asterisk's theme!
  7. Dark mode support


Annotation tuning

  1. Customize annotation max width
  2. Change text size
  3. Show / hide author names on annotations
  4. Apply your tunings to all annotations on a page at once


* Asterisk must be open for annotations to follow their targets
